One of the thousands of firefighters battling a series of wildfires across Southern California has died. See photos from the fires and read more. One of the thousands of firefighters battling the fourth-largest wildfire in history across Southern California has died. A firefighter was killed battling a massive blaze northwest of Los Angeles that is now considered to be California’s fourth largest wildfire in the state’s history, fire officials announced Thursday.

factText: SANTA BARBARA, Calif. (AP) — A firefighter died Thursday while working a colossal wildfire burning in coastal mountains northwest of Los Angeles that has become the fourth largest in California.. Funds will go to relief and recovery efforts in communities impacted by the Southern California wildfires, from Santa Barbara to San Diego. The Thomas fire is raging along the coast in Ventura and Santa Barbara counties.
